intro: Saccolabium chrysanthum, commonly known as the golden saccolabium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in summer, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. It typically grows in dry, open areas and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
